discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Splunk's licensing is primarily based on the amount of data indexed.

The License Meter runs on the Indexer after Parsing and before Indexing.

See page 40 of the Splunk 7.x Fundamentals Part 1 PDF

questions.question_text: Beginning parentheses is automatically highlighted to guide you on the presence of complimenting parentheses.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Splunk's search interface does indeed automatically highlight the beginning parenthesis when you type a closing parenthesis, making it easier to match parentheses and write clear, accurate search queries.

Selected Answer: B
Search assistant does highlight the beginning parentheses when you are typing the closing (complementing) parentheses.
Using Splunk 9.0.5 I can confirm that when I open a parenthesis and then close it, it highlights the beginning parenthesis.

questions.question_text: Zoom Out and Zoom to Selection re-executes the search.

discussion.content: Answer is Yes. PDF document Page-68

This is a trick question. alisyed & DaddyP are correct, Page 68 of the .PDF does specify both Zoom Out and Zoom to Selection re-executes the search. If you believe the answer is No, it is because you are getting confused with simply highlighting/selecting a portion of the timeline--that is what filters the results, but does not re-execute the search.

Selected Answer: B
Yes, Zoom to selection and Zoom Out

the answer should be NO , because you are filtering not re-executing 
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Search/Usethetimeline?_ga=2.21792632.236066794.1678599914-1629913031.1673279898&_gac=1.51632859.1675891174.CjwKCAiArY2fBhB9EiwAWqHK6lidm8pwLqEwMepmebqqLogu-v2cxWKoXRBYjymfsIV1jGNI8KYgZBoC9iwQAvD_BwE&_gl=1*g66dx3*_ga*MTYyOTkxMzAzMS4xNjczMjc5ODk4*_ga_5EPM2P39FV*MTY3ODkzMTczMC42OC4xLjE2Nzg5MzI3MDguNTUuMC4w#Zoom_in_and_zoom_out_to_investigate_events
The Answer is Yes. Page 68
Yes is correct, page 68 from PDF

Zoom out - Expands the time focus and re-executes the search.
Zoom to Selection - Narrows the time range and re-executes the search.
Answer is A. No re-execution of search. Only filtering of existing search happens.
he answer should be NO

questions.question_text: Every Search in Splunk is also called _____________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Every search you run in Splunk is referred to as a job.
